meanings.definition: The act of selling goods informally in public places.
meanings.sent1: At the market, the hawkings of fresh fruits and vegetables attracted many customers.
meanings.sent2: The street vendors engaged in hawkings of their handmade crafts.
meanings.sent3: The children set up a pretend hawkings stand with their toys to play store.
meanings.sent4: Her persuasive skills in the art of hawkings could sell sand in a desert.
meanings.sent5: The colorful display of goods at the hawkings stall caught the eye of passersby.

meanings.definition: The act of hunting with trained hawks or falcons.
meanings.sent1: In medieval times, hawkings was a popular sport among nobles.
meanings.sent2: The ancient art of hawkings requires patience and skill.
meanings.sent3: During the hawkings event, the falcon unexpectedly caught a squirrel instead of a rabbit.
meanings.sent4: The precision of the hawkings team in capturing prey was truly impressive.
meanings.sent5: The majestic sight of hawks soaring through the sky during hawkings is breathtaking.
